intro: Lannea katangensis, commonly known as the Katanga lannea, is a deciduous tree native to central Africa. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae and is characterized by its thick, corky bark and elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by orange-red, fleshy fruits. Lannea katangensis is adapted to dry and semi-arid conditions, making it a resilient species in tropical savanna environments. It plays a role in local ecosystems and has potential uses in traditional medicine.
